Ingredients.2: 4 (5 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, pounded to an even thickness

Ingredients.4: 0.5 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.7: 0.5 (8 ounce) jar sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drained and chopped

Ingredients.10: 1 pinch red pepper flakes, or more as needed

Directions.1: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add spaghetti and a liberal amount of salt to the boiling water and cook, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain pasta and transfer to a large serving bowl. Reserve 1 cup pasta water.

Directions.2: While pasta is cooking, coat chicken with salt and pepper on both sides.

Directions.3: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Remove chicken and chop into bite-sized pieces. Set aside.

Directions.4: Add bacon to the same pan and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels and cut into small pieces.

Directions.5: Add sun-dried tomatoes, garlic, basil, and red pepper flakes to the bacon fat and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken and bacon and reduce heat to just above a simmer. Stir in milk and cornstarch. Add chicken broth, mozzarella cheese, and Parmesan cheese; stir and simmer until well mixed and cheeses have melted.

Directions.6: Slowly add 1/2 cup pasta water to the sauce; stir and allow the sauce to thicken up to desired consistency, adding more pasta water as needed. Pour sauce over pasta to serve.
